Some religions have specific teachings relating to wisdom. In [[Mesopotamian mythology|Mesopotamian Religion and Mythology]] [[Enki]], also known as Ea, was the God of wisdom and intelligence. Wisdom was achieved by restoring balance.
    −
In [[Islam]], according to the [[Koran]] the Prophet [[Muhammed]] was chosen by God to represent his wisdom. The Prophet [[Muhammad]] said that: "Fearing [[God]] in your actions and intentions, and knowing that Almighty [[God]] is watching you wherever and whenever you are in the peak of wisdom".

In [[Islam]], according to the [[Qur'an]] the Prophet [[Muhammed]] was chosen by God to represent his wisdom. The Prophet [[Muhammad]] said that: "Fearing [[God]] in your actions and intentions, and knowing that Almighty [[God]] is watching you wherever and whenever you are in the peak of wisdom".
     
In the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[Bible]], the [[magi]] (or "wise men") are sent by God to give the newly born [[Jesus]] three types of gifts. Wisdom is also represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. [[Proverbs]] 9:10 says: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom," and 8:13 "To fear the Lord is to hate evil;"
